result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Barry A Richardson in court with attorney Lester H Liptak.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Liptak recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CF257
Count 1 - Guilty plea
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

15CF461 - DRI - Court orders defendant report to jail to be fingerprinted today - If cannot do it today report tomorrow between 1:00 - 5:00 pm.

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 01:00 pm for 1 hour.

15CF461 - Attorney Liptak pleads not guilty on behalf of defendant.

  Plea hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
